scenarioDescription:
The Gl 49 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Gl 49 is a star with 0.52 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.51 times its radius. It is located 32.14 light years away from the solar system.

Gl 49 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Gl 49 system


Gl 49 b

Gl 49 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2019-04, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Gl 49 b is 5.632 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Gl 49 b is 2.240 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Gl 49 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Gl 49, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: Gl 49 - System With 1 Exoplanet
